articles.author: Andrew Mills, Humeyra Pamuk, Matt Spetalnick
articles.description: Donald Trump's incoming Middle East envoy has traveled to Qatar and Israel to kick-start the U.S. president-elect's diplomatic push to reach a Gaza ceasefire and hostage release deal before he takes office on Jan 20, a source briefed on the talks told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Trump's Middle East envoy in diplomatic push to reach Gaza ceasefire before inauguration

articles.author: Joyce Lee, Hyunjoo Jin
articles.description: South Korea's parliament formally introduced a motion on Thursday to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol over a botched attempt to impose martial law, but his party vowed to oppose the move, throwing the process into doubt.
articles.title: South Korean ruling party to oppose Yoon's impeachment

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The no-confidence motions are all but certain to oust the government, throwing the euro zone's second-biggest economy deeper into a lingering political crisis.
articles.title: French lawmakers set to vote on ousting Prime Minister Barnier

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te called on Thursday for fellow democracies to unite against authoritarianism to safeguard peace in the region, speaking while on a visit to the U.S. territory of Guam which is home to a major military base.
articles.title: Visiting Guam, Taiwan president calls for fellow democracies to unite against authoritarianism

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: UNESCO recognized Japan's ancient process of sake brewing as an "intangible cultural heritage" on Wednesday, which producers hope will boost global interest in the traditional rice wine that dates back centuries but has waned in popularity at home.
articles.title: Japan's centuries-old sake tradition recognized on UNESCO cultural heritage list

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol has accepted the resignation of Defence Minister Kim Yong-hyun and nominated his ambassador to Saudi Arabia, Choi Byung-hyuk, as new defence minister, Yonhap news reported on Thursday.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon names new defence minister after botched martial law

articles.author: Lucinda Elliott, Lisandra Paraguassu, Anthony Boadle
articles.description: South America's Mercosur trade bloc will meet in Uruguay on Thursday with fresh signs the group could use the event to announce a long-delayed deal with the European Union after last-minute negotiations to get it over the line.
articles.title: South American, EU negotiators race to close divisive trade deal

articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg
articles.description: Amnesty International accused the state of Israel of committing genocide against Palestinians in the Gaza war in a report published on Thursday, an allegation Israeli leaders have repeatedly denied.
articles.title: Amnesty report says Israel has committed genocide against Palestinians in Gaza

articles.author: Dave Sherwood, Marc Frank
articles.description: Cuba said it was generating only enough electricity to cover about 1/6th of peak demand late on Wednesday, hours after its national grid collapsed leaving millions without power.
articles.title: Millions in Cuba remain in dark after nationwide blackout

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva officially recognized three more Indigenous territories on Wednesday, pushing to 13 the number of lands to which he has granted legal protection since his latest term began in early 2023.
articles.title: Brazil's Lula recognizes three more Indigenous territories
